parameters: That should be good. Let that ointment stay for ten minutes. Your
Alright, but I'm telling you I'm fine, uh...
It's Gertrud! That's the third time I've told you now!
Yeah, sorry, I'm bad with names.
I've just met so many people that remembering all the little things
like that? Well, it gets hard.
Ah yes, you did mention that. Traveling from town to town, going on
wild adventures and so on and so forth.
Trust me, I could go on for ages! Did I ever tell you about the
time I came face to face with this forty foot long viper? That's a
What's with the laugh? Think I'm a liar? Here, I'll show you the scar to-
Trust me, I believe you. Your body tells many tales. I would be a fool to
It's just, you remind me of General Hyde. He would always tell me
stories from his youth whilst I was tending to his wounds.
You knew the guy? I guess you're older than you look.
I'm choosing to take that as a compliment, dear.
Anyway... You could see the excitement in his eyes, as if retelling
those old stories put him right back on the battlefield.
He especially loved talking about an old friend of his, though
unfortunately I never had the chance to speak with him.
He never made it explicit, but one could tell the two had grown distant.
Yeah, well, people drift apart pretty often. It's one of those ugly
truths that nobody wants to tell you about until it's too late.
Not that I'll remember, but do you know what the name of his friend
He mentioned it quite often, he did. His name was Augustus.
Was he like, a big guy? With big fuzzy eyebrows?
I thought I told you to stay put while your skin absorbed the
I already told you I didn't know the man myself, just whatever
Hyde would tell me about him.
That said, I think I do remember Hyde mentioning his eyebrows...
I think I know someone who might want to talk with you.
Manners! I know it's not my sister's house but that doesn't mean you
can just act like a pig all you want.
Sorry, I'm just dealing with the aftereffects of some improper
Oh, Uncle Eli's home. Hi, Eli!
I heard from Emma that you left in the middle of your shift today for
Ingrid, what's wrong? You seem about ready to pop any minute now.
Stop working to eat at a buffet all evening?
No, and I'll- *hrph* I'll be fine.
That still doesn't explain why you decided to just up and leave like
that. It have to do with that pie creature that was jumping around
earlier today? I was worried sick!
Don't tell me you tried conjuring! I don't mean to offend, but you
No, it wasn't ME, specifically. I told... someone... about teleportation
crystals and they... summoned this giant pie monster.
Man, your uncle could definitely go for a giant pie monster right
Don't worry, sweetheart, dinner'll be ready soon.
Anyways, how on Skiola did someone who made such a novice mistake
get their hands on such a crystal...? Moreover, why to summon a PIE?
Who knows, haha! ...But I felt guilty, so I went with them to try and...
Here, it'll help with the stomachache.
You left work just to tag along with them? I'm sure that we could've
had someone else handle the situation.
Shoulda called your uncle, Ingrid! I'd've had that thing served on a
silver platter in the blink of an eye! Just 'cause I'm old don't mean
Well, they, uh, wanted me to help them take care of it, so I felt a
little bad for them! You know how it is, right?
Hee hee, if I didn't know any better, I'd have guessed that you just
wanted to spend time with them!
Oh, Aunt Gertrud, it's nothing like that! I-I don't know why you'd make
So be it! I wouldn't fuss about it, Ingrid.
(You and I both know how boring that job is anyway.)
I was just a little curious. Off to bed you go, then.
Oh, you're that man from yesterday. Is this the person you told me
Yeah, she is. Uhh, Archer, this is...uh...
I think we saw each other at the Mess Hall, but I never got the chance
to properly introduce myself to you!
Oh, hi! My name's Autumn! I'm looking for my Pops.
Does your "Pops" happen to be a tall, bulky man with big bushy
It seems like your father was once a close friend of General Hyde
It was through Hyde that my husband, Eli, and I met.
You see, I used to be a war medic, stationed here in this very fort
back when it was still in use.
Woah... You've gotta have tons of stories!
I do, I do. But more relevant to your interest might be those he
You see, before General Hyde had been sent to lead this fort here,
he was a member of the capital's royal guard for many, many years.
He made many friends there, including who I assume to be your father.
Pops was a soldier for the capital...?
That's right. And not just any soldier, according to Hyde. Your
father was an expert marksman and archer; the best of the best.
So that's where he learned how to do it... I guess I never could
beat Pops, no matter how hard I tried.
However, something came between their friendship. What it was, Hyde
would never say. After Hyde came to this fort, the two never saw
Pops never told me about anyone he knew before we came to the
It would seem as though there is much he wants to keep hidden from
Just like when he ran away that day... But why?
In my experience, a person only hides secrets for two reasons:
...Or they want to protect someone else.
Unfortunately, the only image I have of your father is woven through
the tales of another man's memories. You'll have to decide his
You've been a great help, Miss Gertrud! Thanks a lot for the info!
Oh, by the way, do you know where I can find another elf named
Ingrid? We wanted to say good-bye to her before we left.
Thanks for helping us out with that pie monster!! You were so cool!
Those magic abilities were pretty kickass.
See!? And Merc's actually really hard to impress...
You'd be such a big help to our team!
Oh, that's right. You've got your... work and stuff. I forgot, sorry.
Darn, if only that wasn't in the way.
We'll miss you, Ingrey! Take care!
Yes, well, she's a busy woman. Uhm... farewell, you too. I've got my
own business to attend to as well.
Alright, see you too, Miss Gertrud.
Oh, you guys stopped by! Would you like some tea?
I've got something cooking in the back if you're hungry, too.
I assume that was the person you were talking about, yesterday.
Yeah, no, she's nice. She's a nice girl.
You left your work just for her, and yet you can't even look her in
Yeah, whatever. I've got to get ready or else I'll be late. Emma would
What if... you did take her offer?
And LEAVE? Aunt Gertrud, that's ridiculous!
I mean, I can't just quit the library!
But it sounds fun, doesn't it?
It DOES! But you know how my parents would freak out if I decided to
up and leave just because I felt like it!
It was a hard decision for me to settle down with your uncle Eli, here.
But if I didn't take that leap, I'd regret it for the rest of my life.
I understand that what they want for you is important, but just look
Once this library internship finishes, you'll go back to Elven Green
and look for a job or try to find experience elsewhere.
You're smart, I have no doubt that you'll be able to find something.
But... do you think you'd be happy with that?
Our own parents greatly valued planning and forethought. To consider
where we would want our future selves to be was a habit that was
drilled into our heads as children.
When I left, they must've thought that I was being a fool. Or that I'd
"Why would you give up on your studies? What good will that do for
you? You'll never make a name for yourself if you continue down that
But at the end of the day, they just wanted what they thought was
best for me and your mother, and while it might've been enticing
to her, it wasn't satisfying enough for me.
What you want for your future, is it more of this?
At some point, you've got to stop drifting by on others' expectations.
And I know that it may sound like I'm telling you to do all this because
of MY own thoughts, but I just want you to take things into your
Just because you don't think you're strong doesn't mean you can't
handle what life's got in store for you.
Now, whether you decide to go back to the library or follow that
girl or do Skiola knows what else, one thing is for certain:
I need that decision to be yours and yours alone. Understand?
A selection of potions on sale from Gertrud's store.
